page.title: 04TRANSPORT, PUBLIC SERVICES
page.content: In 1966 the Railway closed down in Sturminster Newton. We have a bus service which goes to Blandford every day and to Yeovil every Saturday. We have several taxi services here in Sturminster. We have only one general haulage firm here,they are called R and M Shepard. They own two lorries, six trailers and a warehouse. Cardboard and milk powder is stored for St Ivel foods and Cow and Gate. The firm used to go to the Continent but there was not much money in it so they stopped going.An average wage of a lorry driver is about Â£150 a week. Lorry firms work out their bills for the work they do by pence per mile. It is usually about 70 pence per mile. To tax a lorry for a year cost's about Â£4,000 a year.
